page.title: 02Wivelsfield - Social Concern
page.content:
One of the principal causes for concern recently has been a proposal to change the County Boundary between East and West Sussex. At a meeting held in the Village Hall the majority voted to remain in East Sussex.
In World's End, a home for the elderly provides sheltered accomodation arranged as 15 flats with a resident warden. The residents have social evenings and can do their own shopping at the local shops. Each of the rooms in the flats has a bell which will summon assistance if required. The residents also have the use of a communal laundry room.
A doctor's surgery is held once a week in Wivelsfield Village Hall.This is of great help to the elderly and those unable to travel to the nearby towns.
